title: Rattanakosin Kingdom (1782–1932)
summary: The Rattanakosin Kingdom (Thai: อาณาจักรรัตนโกสินทร์, pronounced [ʔāːnāːt͡ɕàk ráttāná(ʔ)kōːsǐn] (listen), or shortened to, Thai: รัตนโกสินทร์, Thai pronunciation: [ráttāná(ʔ)kōːsǐn]) is the fourth and present Thai kingdom in the history of Thailand, which was formerly known as Siam until 1939. It was founded in 1782 with the establishment of Rattanakosin (Bangkok), which replaced the city of Thonburi as the capital of Siam. This article covers the period until the Siamese revolution of 1932.
